author: Alexia Fernandez
title: Screen Actors Guild Awards 2017: Hacksaw Ridge Wins Outstanding Performance by a Stunt Ensemble in a Motion Picture
text:
Congratulations to Hacksaw Ridge !
The Mel Gibson -directed war film received the Screen Actors Guild Award for outstanding performance by a stunt ensemble in a motion picture, PEOPLE exclusively revealed on the SAG Awards red carpet.
Hacksaw Ridge , which stars Andrew Garfield, Vince Vaughn and Hugo Weaving, reintroduced Gibson to the awards circuit, and has been nominated for multiple awards at the Golden Globes and the Academy Awards.
PEOPLE and Entertainment Weekly are hosting the official live pre-show for the SAG Awards on Sunday, Jan. 29 , in partnership with TNT and sponsored by Dunkin’ Donuts. Our red carpet special will start livestreaming at 5:30 p.m. ET /2:30 PT on PEOPLE.com , EW.com and the People/Entertainment Weekly Network (download the PEN app for your TV or phone). You can also watch it live on Twitter — follow us @PEOPLE ! The film follows the true tale of a Virginia farm boy-turned-army medic Desmond Doss, played by Garfield, who was credited with saving dozens of soldiers during the Battle of Okinawa despite refusing to carry a weapon or kill his enemies.
Check out PEOPLE’s full 2017 Screen Actors Guild Awards coverage and complete winners list ! Garfield was also nominated for outstanding performance by a male actor in a leading role at the SAG Awards, competing against Ryan Gosling for La La Land , Denzel Washington in Fences , Casey Affleck in Manchester by the Sea , and Viggo Mortensen in Captain Fantastic .
Other nominees for outstanding performance by a stunt ensemble in a motion picture included Captain America: Civil War , Doctor Strange , Jason Bourne and Nocturnal Animals .
The 23rd annual Screen Actors Guild Awards will air live on Sun., Jan. 29, 2017 at 8 p.m. ET/5 PT. on TNT and TBS.
